member.name: M:Unigine.Plugins.AppProjection.showSetupWindow
member.summary: Shows the setup window for the AppProjection plugin.

member.name: M:Unigine.Plugins.AppProjection.setResolutionUpscale(float)
member.summary: Sets the resolution upscale factor.
member.param: Resolution upscale factor.

member.name: M:Unigine.Plugins.AppProjection.getResolutionUpscale
member.summary: Returns the current resolution upscale factor.
member.returns: Resolution upscale factor.

member.name: M:Unigine.Plugins.AppProjection.setPluginEnabled(bool)
member.summary: Enables or disables the AppProjection plugin. All distortions will be removed.
member.param: true to enable the AppProjection plugin; false to disable it.

member.name: M:Unigine.Plugins.AppProjection.isPluginEnabled
member.summary: Returns a value indicating if the AppProjection plugin is enabled.
member.returns: true if the AppProjection plugin is enabled; otherwise, false.

member.name: M:Unigine.Plugins.AppProjection.projectionGetWidth
member.summary: Returns the number of projections set via video_width CLI option.
member.returns: Number of projections.

member.name: M:Unigine.Plugins.AppProjection.setPrimary(int)
member.summary: Specifies which projection to use as a primary one.
member.param: Projection number, in the range from 0 to the total number of projections.

member.name: M:Unigine.Plugins.AppProjection.getPrimary
member.summary: Returns the number of projection, which is used as a primary one.
member.returns: Projection number, in the range from 0 to the total number of projections.

member.name: M:Unigine.Plugins.AppProjection.saveState(Unigine.Ptr{Unigine.Stream})
member.summary: Saves current states of all projections (warping, blending, color, etc.) to the specified stream. Saving into the stream requires creating a blob to save into. To restore the saved state the restoreState() method is used:
member.param: Stream to save state data for all projections.
member.returns: true on success; otherwise, false.

member.name: M:Unigine.Plugins.AppProjection.saveState(int,Unigine.Ptr{Unigine.Stream})
member.summary: Saves the current state of the projection with the specified number to the specified stream. Saving into the stream requires creating a blob to save into. To restore the saved state the restoreState() method is used:
member.param: Projection number, in the range from 0 to the total number of projections.
Stream to save state data for the specified projection.
member.returns: true on success; otherwise, false.

member.name: M:Unigine.Plugins.AppProjection.restoreState(Unigine.Ptr{Unigine.Stream})
member.summary: Restores states of all projections (warping, blending, color, etc.) from the specified stream. Restoring from the stream requires creating a blob to save into and saving the state using the saveState() method:
member.param: Stream containing saved state data for all projections.
member.returns: true on success; otherwise, false.

member.name: M:Unigine.Plugins.AppProjection.restoreState(int,Unigine.Ptr{Unigine.Stream})
member.summary: Restores the state of the projection with the specified number from the specified stream. Restoring from the stream requires creating a blob to save into and saving the state using the saveState() method:
member.param: Projection number, in the range from 0 to the total number of projections.
Stream containing saved state data for the specified projection.
member.returns: true on success; otherwise, false.

member.name: M:Unigine.Plugins.AppProjection.reset
member.summary: Resets all parameters (warping, blending, color, etc.) of all projections to default values.

member.name: M:Unigine.Plugins.AppProjection.reset(int)
member.summary: Resets all parameters (warping, blending, color, etc.) of the specified projection to default values.
member.param: Projection number, in the range from 0 to the total number of projections.

member.name: M:Unigine.Plugins.AppProjection.save(char,int)
member.summary: Saves configurations of all projections to the specified file.
member.param: Path to a .proj file, to which configurations of all projections are to be saved.
1 to save in binary format, 0 to save in XML format. The default value is 0.

member.name: M:Unigine.Plugins.AppProjection.save(int,char,int)
member.summary: Saves configuration of the specified projection to the specified file.
member.param: Projection number, in the range from 0 to the total number of projections.
Path to a .proj file, to which configuration of the specified projection is to be saved.
1 to save in binary format, 0 to save in XML format. The default value is 0.

member.name: M:Unigine.Plugins.AppProjection.load(char,int)
member.summary: Loads configurations of all projections from the specified file.
member.param: Path to a .proj file containing configurations of all projections.
1 to save in binary format, 0 to save in XML format. The default value is 0.

member.name: M:Unigine.Plugins.AppProjection.load(int,char,int)
member.summary: Loads configuration of the specified projection from the specified file.
member.param: Projection number, in the range from 0 to the total number of projections.
Path to a .proj file containing configuration of the specified projection.
1 to save in binary format, 0 to save in XML format. The default value is 0.

member.name: M:Unigine.Plugins.AppProjection.setEnabled(int,int)
member.summary: Enables the specified projection for viewport rendering.
member.param: Projection number, in the range from 0 to the total number of projections.
1 to enable the projection for rendering; 0 to disable it.

member.name: M:Unigine.Plugins.AppProjection.isEnabled(int)
member.summary: Returns a value indicating if the specified projection is enabled for viewport rendering.
member.param: Projection number, in the range from 0 to the total number of projections.
member.returns: 1 if the projection is enabled for rendering; otherwise, 0.

member.name: M:Unigine.Plugins.AppProjection.setViewportMask(int,int)
member.summary: Sets a viewport bit mask for the specified projection. Object surfaces, materials, decals, lights and GUI objects will be rendered into this viewport only if their viewport mask matches this one (one matching bit is enough).
member.param: Projection number, in the range from 0 to the total number of projections.
Integer, each bit of which is a mask.

member.name: M:Unigine.Plugins.AppProjection.setReflectionViewportMask(int,int)
member.summary: Sets a bit mask for rendering reflections on the specified projection. Reflections are rendered in the viewport if masks of reflective materials match this one (one matching bit is enough).
member.param: Projection number, in the range from 0 to the total number of projections.
Integer, each bit of which is a mask.

member.name: M:Unigine.Plugins.AppProjection.setProjection(int,Unigine.Math.mat4)
member.summary: Sets the projection matrix for the specified projection.
member.param: Projection number, in the range from 0 to the total number of projections.
Projection matrix.

member.name: M:Unigine.Plugins.AppProjection.getProjection(int)
member.summary: Returns the current projection matrix used for the specified projection.
member.param: Projection number, in the range from 0 to the total number of projections.
member.returns: Projection matrix used for the specified projection.

member.name: M:Unigine.Plugins.AppProjection.setModelview(int,Unigine.Math.Mat4)
member.summary: Sets the model-view matrix for the specified projection.
member.param: Projection number, in the range from 0 to the total number of projections.
Model-view matrix.

member.name: M:Unigine.Plugins.AppProjection.getModelview(int)
member.summary: Gets the current model-view matrix used for the specified projection.
member.param: Projection number, in the range from 0 to the total number of projections.
member.returns: Model-view matrix used for the specified projection.

member.name: M:Unigine.Plugins.AppProjection.setMaterials(int,char)
member.summary: Sets postprocess materials to be applied to the specified projection.
member.param: Projection number, in the range from 0 to the total number of projections.
Postprocess materials (comma-separated list).

member.name: M:Unigine.Plugins.AppProjection.setAngle(int,int)
member.summary: Sets canvas rotation angle for the specified projection.
member.param: Projection number, in the range from 0 to the total number of projections.
Canvas rotation angle:0 - 0 degrees1 - 90 degrees2 - 180 degrees3 - 270 degrees

member.name: M:Unigine.Plugins.AppProjection.getAngle(int)
member.summary: Returns the current canvas rotation angle for the specified projection.
member.param: Projection number, in the range from 0 to the total number of projections.
member.returns: Current canvas rotation angle:0 - 0 degrees1 - 90 degrees2 - 180 degrees3 - 270 degrees

member.name: M:Unigine.Plugins.AppProjection.setFlipHorizontal(int,int)
member.summary: Enables or disables horizontal flipping of canvas for the specified projection.
member.param: Projection number, in the range from 0 to the total number of projections.
1 to enable horizontal flipping for the canvas of the specified projection, 0 to disable it.

member.name: M:Unigine.Plugins.AppProjection.isFlipHorizontal(int)
member.summary: Returns a value indicating if the canvas of the specified projection is flipped horizontally.
member.param: Projection number, in the range from 0 to the total number of projections.
member.returns: 1 if the canvas of the specified projection is flipped horizontally; otherwise, 0.

member.name: M:Unigine.Plugins.AppProjection.setFlipVertical(int,int)
member.summary: Enables or disables vertical flipping of canvas for the specified projection.
member.param: Projection number, in the range from 0 to the total number of projections.
1 to enable vertical flipping for the canvas of the specified projection, 0 to disable it.

member.name: M:Unigine.Plugins.AppProjection.isFlipVertical(int)
member.summary: Returns a value indicating if the canvas of the specified projection is flipped vertically.
member.param: Projection number, in the range from 0 to the total number of projections.
member.returns: 1 if the canvas of the specified projection is flipped vertically; otherwise, 0.

member.name: M:Unigine.Plugins.AppProjection.setDebugFillColor(int,int)
member.summary: Sets a color to be used for the specified projection in debug mode. Setting individual colors for different projections enables you to visualize overlapping regions for different projections and facilitates the setup process.
member.param: Projection number, in the range from 0 to the total number of projections.
Color to be used for the specified projection in debug mode, one of the following values:0 - no color1 - red2 - green3 - blue4 - cyan5 - magenta6 - yellow7 - white8 - black

member.name: M:Unigine.Plugins.AppProjection.getDebugFillColor(int)
member.summary: Returns the current color used for the specified projection in debug mode. Setting individual colors for different projections enables you to visualize overlapping regions for different projections and facilitates the setup process.
member.param: Projection number, in the range from 0 to the total number of projections.
member.returns: Color currently used for the specified projection in debug mode, one of the following values:0 - no color1 - red2 - green3 - blue4 - cyan5 - magenta6 - yellow7 - white8 - black

member.name: M:Unigine.Plugins.AppProjection.setDebugShowGrid(int,int)
member.summary: Enables or disables visualization of warping grid for the specified projection on the screen. This option significantly facilitates the process of debugging configuration of a multi-projector setup.
member.param: Projection number, in the range from 0 to the total number of projections.
1 to enable visualization of warping grid for the specified projection on the screen, 0 to disable it.

member.name: M:Unigine.Plugins.AppProjection.isDebugShowGrid(int)
member.summary: Returns a value indicating if warping grid for the specified projection is displayed on the screen. This option significantly facilitates the process of debugging configuration of a multi-projector setup.
member.param: Projection number, in the range from 0 to the total number of projections.
member.returns: 1 if warping grid for the specified projection is displayed on the screen; otherwise, 0.

member.name: M:Unigine.Plugins.AppProjection.setDebugShowWarpPoints(int,int)
member.summary: Enables or disables visualization of warping control points for the specified projection on the screen. This option significantly facilitates the process of debugging configuration of a multi-projector setup.
member.param: Projection number, in the range from 0 to the total number of projections.
1 to enable visualization of warping control points for the specified projection on the screen, 0 to disable it.

member.name: M:Unigine.Plugins.AppProjection.isDebugShowWarpPoints(int)
member.summary: Returns a value indicating if warping control points for the specified projection are displayed on the screen. This option significantly facilitates the process of debugging configuration of a multi-projector setup.
member.param: Projection number, in the range from 0 to the total number of projections.
member.returns: 1 if warping control points for the specified projection are displayed on the screen; otherwise, 0.

member.name: M:Unigine.Plugins.AppProjection.setWarpPoints(int,Unigine.Vector{Unigine.Math.vec2,int,Unigine.VectorAllocator},int,int)
member.summary: Sets warping grid size (width, height) and positions of all its control points for the specified projection.
member.param: Projection number, in the range from 0 to the total number of projections.
Vector containing positions of all warping grid points. Vector size is determined by the values for columns and rows specified.
Grid width, defines the number of warping grid points horizontally.
Grid height, defines the number of warping grid points vertically.

member.name: M:Unigine.Plugins.AppProjection.getWarpPoints(int,Unigine.Vector{Unigine.Math.vec2,int,Unigine.VectorAllocator},int,int)
member.summary: Gets the current size (width, height) of the warping grid along with positions of all its control points for the specified projection and puts them to the specified variables.
member.param: Projection number, in the range from 0 to the total number of projections.
Vector to which positions of all warping grid points are to be put.
Grid width, defines the number of warping grid points horizontally.
Grid height, defines the number of warping grid points vertically.

member.name: M:Unigine.Plugins.AppProjection.setWarpHandles(int,Unigine.Vector{Unigine.Math.vec2,int,Unigine.VectorAllocator})
member.summary: Sets coordinates of control handles for all warping grid points of the specified projection.
member.param: Projection number, in the range from 0 to the total number of projections.
Vector containing coordinates of handles for all warping grid points. First half - vertical handles, next half - horizontal ones.
The number of control handles must be twice as large as the number of grid points, as there are two handles for each point.

member.name: M:Unigine.Plugins.AppProjection.getWarpHandles(int,Unigine.Vector{Unigine.Math.vec2,int,Unigine.VectorAllocator})
member.summary: Gets coordinates of control handles of all warping grid points for the specified projection and puts them to the specified vector.
member.param: Projection number, in the range from 0 to the total number of projections.
Vector containing coordinates of control handles for all mask polygon points. First half - vertical handles, next half - horizontal ones.
The number of control handles must be twice as large as the number of grid points, as there are two handles for each point.

member.name: M:Unigine.Plugins.AppProjection.resetWarpGrid(int)
member.summary: Resets warping grid for the specified projection to the default one.
member.param: Projection number, in the range from 0 to the total number of projections.

member.name: M:Unigine.Plugins.AppProjection.setBorderBlend(int,int,Unigine.Math.vec4)
member.summary: Sets edge blending parameters for the specified side of the specified projection.
member.param: Projection number, in the range from 0 to the total number of projections.
Number of projection's side:0 - left1 - right2 - top3 - bottom

Four-component vector containing soft edge blending parameters for the specified side of the specified projection: (X - size, Y - alpha, Z - contrast, W - gamma).The power component should have a non-zero value to enable blending.

member.name: M:Unigine.Plugins.AppProjection.getBorderBlend(int,int)
member.summary: Returns current edge blending parameters for the specified side of the specified projection.
member.param: Projection number, in the range from 0 to the total number of projections.
Number of projection's side:0 - left1 - right2 - top3 - bottom
member.returns: Four-component vector containing soft edge blending parameters for the specified side of the specified projection: (X - size, Y - alpha, Z - contrast, W - gamma).The power component should have a non-zero value to enable blending.

member.name: M:Unigine.Plugins.AppProjection.setMultiplyImage(int,Unigine.Ptr{Unigine.Image})
member.summary: Sets the edge blending map for the specified projection.
member.param: Projection number, in the range from 0 to the total number of projections.
Pointer to an image with an edge blending map to be set.

member.name: M:Unigine.Plugins.AppProjection.setMultiplyTexture(int,Unigine.Ptr{Unigine.Texture})
member.summary: Sets the edge blending map for the specified projection.
member.param: Projection number, in the range from 0 to the total number of projections.
Pointer to a texture with an edge blending map to be set.

member.name: M:Unigine.Plugins.AppProjection.getMultiplyTexture(int)
member.summary: Returns the current edge blending map for the specified projection.
member.param: Projection number, in the range from 0 to the total number of projections.
member.returns: Current edge blending map.

member.name: M:Unigine.Plugins.AppProjection.addBlend(int,Unigine.Vector{Unigine.Math.vec2,int,Unigine.VectorAllocator},Unigine.Vector{Unigine.Math.vec2,int,Unigine.VectorAllocator},Unigine.Vector{Unigine.Math.vec2,int,Unigine.VectorAllocator})
member.summary: Adds a new screen-space blend area for the specified projection. The form of the new screen-space blend area is defined by the positions of points and control handles (left and right) stored in the vectors specified. All three vectors must have the same size.
member.param: Projection number, in the range from 0 to the total number of projections.
Vector containing positions of all screen-space blend area polygon points.
Vector containing coordinates of left control handles for all screen-space blend area polygon points.
Vector containing coordinates of right control handles for all screen-space blend area polygon points.
member.returns: Number of the last added screen-space blend area.

member.name: M:Unigine.Plugins.AppProjection.getBlend(int,int,Unigine.Vector{Unigine.Math.vec2,int,Unigine.VectorAllocator},Unigine.Vector{Unigine.Math.vec2,int,Unigine.VectorAllocator},Unigine.Vector{Unigine.Math.vec2,int,Unigine.VectorAllocator})
member.summary: Gets all points, along with their control handles, for the specified screen-space blend area of the specified projection and puts the data to the corresponding vectors specified.
member.param: Projection number, in the range from 0 to the total number of projections.
Screen-space blend area number, in the range from 0 to the total number of screen-space blend areas.
Vector containing positions of all screen-space blend area polygon points.
Vector containing coordinates of left control handles for all screen-space blend area polygon points.
Vector containing coordinates of right control handles for all screen-space blend area polygon points.

member.name: M:Unigine.Plugins.AppProjection.getNumBlends(int)
member.summary: Returns the total number of screen-space blend areas assigned for the specified projection. Blends can be used for blending regions or to cut out certain areas (e.g. top and bottom areas for a curved screen projection).
member.param: Projection number, in the range from 0 to the total number of projections.
member.returns: Total number of blends assigned for the specified projection, including the ones enabled and disabled.

member.name: M:Unigine.Plugins.AppProjection.setBlendEnabled(int,int,int)
member.summary: Enables or disables the specified screen-space blend area of the specified projection.
member.param: Projection number, in the range from 0 to the total number of projections.
Screen-space blend area number, in the range from 0 to the total number of screen-space blend areas.
1 to enable the specified screen-space blend area of the specified projection, 0 to disable it.

member.name: M:Unigine.Plugins.AppProjection.isBlendEnabled(int,int)
member.summary: Returns a value indicating if the specified screen-space blend area of the specified projection is enabled.
member.param: Projection number, in the range from 0 to the total number of projections.
Screen-space blend area number, in the range from 0 to the total number of screen-space blend areas.
member.returns: 1 if warping grid for the specified projection is displayed on the screen; otherwise, 0.

member.name: M:Unigine.Plugins.AppProjection.setBlendAlpha(int,int,float)
member.summary: Sets a new transparency value for the specified screen-space blend area of the specified projection.
member.param: Projection number, in the range from 0 to the total number of projections.
Screen-space blend area number, in the range from 0 to the total number of screen-space blend areas.
New transparency value to be set.

member.summary: Returns the current transparency value for the specified screen-space blend area of the specified projection.
member.param: Projection number, in the range from 0 to the total number of projections.
Screen-space blend area number, in the range from 0 to the total number of screen-space blend areas.
member.returns: Current transparency value.

member.summary: Returns the current gradient part contrast value for the specified screen-space blend area of the specified projection.
member.param: Projection number, in the range from 0 to the total number of projections.
Screen-space blend area number, in the range from 0 to the total number of screen-space blend areas.

member.name: M:Unigine.Plugins.AppProjection.setMaskSmooth(int,int,int)

Mask number, in the range from 0 to the total number of masks.
Smoothing value to be set.

member.name: M:Unigine.Plugins.AppProjection.getMaskSmooth(int,int)
member.summary: Returns the current smoothing value used for edges of the specified mask of the specified projection. This value determines the number of additional points to be inserted between the control points of the mask.
member.param: Projection number, in the range from 0 to the total number of projections.
Mask number, in the range from 0 to the total number of masks.

member.summary: Removes all mask created for the specified projection.

member.name: M:Unigine.Plugins.AppProjection.setCornerBrightness(int,Unigine.Math.vec4)
member.summary: Sets brightness correction values for corners of the specified projection using a four-component vector specified.
member.param: Projection number, in the range from 0 to the total number of projections.
Four-component vector containing brightness values, in the [0.0f, 1.0f] range, for projection's corners (upper left, upper right, lower left, lower right).

member.name: M:Unigine.Plugins.AppProjection.getCornerBrightness(int)
member.summary: Returns current brightness correction values for corners of the specified projection as a four-component vector.
member.param: Projection number, in the range from 0 to the total number of projections.
member.returns: Four-component vector containing brightness values, in the [0.0f, 1.0f] range, for projection's corners (upper left, upper right, lower left, lower right).

member.name: M:Unigine.Plugins.AppProjection.addMesh(int,Unigine.Ptr{Unigine.Mesh},Unigine.Math.Mat4)
member.summary: Adds a new mesh for the specified projection. Meshes are used for complex-shaped projection screens.
member.param: Projection number, in the range from 0 to the total number of projections.
Pointer to a mesh to be added.
Mesh transformation.
member.returns: Total number of meshes for the specified projection.

member.name: M:Unigine.Plugins.AppProjection.getMesh(int,int)
member.summary: Returns the specified mesh of the specified projection. Meshes are used for complex-shaped projection screens.
member.param: Projection number, in the range from 0 to the total number of projections.
Mesh number.
member.returns: Mesh pointer.

member.name: M:Unigine.Plugins.AppProjection.getMeshTransform(int,int)
member.summary: Returns the transformation of the specified mesh of the specified projection. Meshes are used for complex-shaped projection screens.
member.param: Projection number, in the range from 0 to the total number of projections.
Mesh number.
member.returns: Mesh transformation.

member.name: M:Unigine.Plugins.AppProjection.resetMesh(int)

member.param: Projection number, in the range from 0 to the total number of projections.
